= loadlevel =

 field: integer loadlevel (zoneptr : zoneptr);

== Description ==
The '''loadlevel''' field returns the load level of a zone. This represents the minimum character level required to load items from that zone. This field is read-only and provides access to zone-level loading restrictions.

== Syntax ==
 zoneptr.loadlevel

== Field Access ==
{| class="wikitable"
! Field !! Type !! Access !! Description
|-
| loadlevel || integer || Read-only || Minimum character level required to load items from zone
|}

== Availability ==
This field is available on the following unit types:
* zoneptr (Zone pointer)

== Return Value ==
Returns '''integer''':
* '''integer''' - Minimum character level required to load items from the zone
* '''fail''' - when zoneptr is null or not applicable

== Examples ==
 dilbegin check_zone_load();
 var
   z: zoneptr;
   player_level: integer;
 code
 {
   z := findzone("midgaard");
   if (z == null)
   {
     log("Zone not found");
     quit;
   }
   
   player_level := self.level;
   if (player_level < z.loadlevel)
   {
     sendtext("You are not high enough level to load items from this zone.&n", self);
     quit;
   }
   
   sendtext("Zone load level: " + z.loadlevel + "&n", self);
 } dilend

 dilbegin zone_info(zonename: string);
 var
   z: zoneptr;
   info: string;
 code
 {
   z := findzone(zonename);
   if (z == null)
   {
     sendtext("Zone '" + zonename + "' not found.&n", self);
     quit;
   }
   
   info := "Zone Information for " + z.name + "&n";
   info := info + "Load Level: " + z.loadlevel + "&n";
   info := info + "Reset Time: " + z.resettime + "&n";
   info := info + "Access Level: " + z.access + "&n";
   
   pagestring(info, self);
 } dilend

== Usage Notes ==
* The loadlevel is a zone-wide setting that affects all items within the zone
* This field is used to enforce level restrictions on item loading
* Players must meet or exceed the loadlevel to load items from the zone
* The loadlevel is typically set in the zone configuration file
* This field is read-only; to modify load levels, you must edit the zone files

== Error Handling ==
* Returns '''fail''' if the zoneptr is null
* Returns '''fail''' if the zone is not applicable
